title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage across the week
text: that 's it from the local live team for this week , so goodbye and enjoy the weekend whatever the weather brings us .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday , bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as they happen .

documents.title: weather : dry night ahead
text: the weather for this evening and tonight will be mainly dry at first across the bbc east region , but cloud thickening from the west will bring the chance of some patchy light rain .
there will be light to moderate southwesterly winds , which will turn more westerly later .
the temperature will dip to 13-15c ( upper 50sf ) .
tomorrow it will mainly dry with a mixture of sunny spells and patchy cloud , but thicker cloud could bring one or two isolated showers , mainly across norfolk .
highs around 20-22c ( near 70f ) .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: essex estate agent 's 'poor taste ' joke highlights brixworth
text: an estate agent 's bid to highlight the best spots for property `` outside a nuclear impact zone '' has been lambasted as being in poor taste - but what it has done is show up brixworth near daventry as a place of safety should the worst happen !
emoov 's press release included a map of blast impact radiation radiuses around the uk in the event of a nuclear war and in doing so showed where the best places to buy property might be .
it was labelled as `` the worst press release ever '' , by a times journalist .
russell quirk , from essex-based online agent emoov , apologised for any offence , but said it was `` completely tongue in cheek '' .
the agent 's press release referred to tensions between north korea and the us , commenting that people might be worried about `` world war three kicking off '' .
`` donald trump and kim jong-un are a pair of clowns , frankly , and they 're acting like jokers , '' mr quirk , of the brentwood-based agency , said .
`` and on that basis , we thought we 'd put out something tongue-in-cheek to show our satirical , humorous side . ''
an assistant editor at the times , david byers , tweeted screenshots of the release and commented : `` genuinely in shock !
who could have imagined this press release was a good idea ? ? ''
worst .
press .
release .
ever .
# nuclearwar
a disturbing amount of research seems to have gone into this
i think they had too much time to play with the nuclear blast app/website and then had a ( not so ) bright idea .
i think that 's a fair deduction
not much research , whitby is only a few miles from raf fylingdales , a first strike target , house prices would be buggered .
missed off awe aldermaston too , imagine that would be high up on the list
looks at map oh , crap .
@ twitterid
whitby will become the capital and we 'll have to fight the seagulls in a civil war .
wan na move to dumfries mate ?
aye definitely
might be the worst press release ever but still spent a good while considering which blast zone i 'd be in & if i 'd survive .
happy to be in the centre of rosyth blast zone .
life wo n't be worth living if there are any survivors .
just do n't press that button # trump
you 're probably right .
my mind struggles to even imagine the consequences .
it 's also bollocks .
our cities would be attacked in a second wave .
the first wave would hit military bases - which are much more spread out .
plus no ones going to strike edinburgh i 'm august .
unless you want to kill old people and students .
i dunno .
there 's a lot of people with grudges against the arts !
you could wipe out most of the world 's stand ups & every single improv group in one strike .
and then the `` agent '' has the nerve to say its `` a bit of fun '' that 's not what many of us are thinking , certainly .
author: Jodie Halford
BBC News

documents.title: rev richard coles : kept strictly secret for months
text: i 've had the great pleasure of talking to the reverend richard coles to find out more about his love of all things sequined and fake tanned !
the finedon vicar revealed this morning he 's to appear in the latest series of the bbc 's strictly come dancing and it took him just three seconds to agree .
he said that `` with great difficutly '' he 'd kept it a secret since march .
he was asked by the shows bosses if he was prepared for an intense degree of interest in him , and had to undergo a medical which was `` hilarious '' .
he added that `` most sensible people would have improved their fitness , but i 'm now fatter and more knackered '' .
mervyn hemmington from northamptonshire has come up with the best strictly pun so far , by saying he 's `` looking forward to seeing his pastor doble '' .
while sally denny says : `` i can see that for the first time ever , we will be watching this religiously ! ! ! ''
author: Richard Smith
BBC News

documents.title: man temporarily blinded by mystery white powder in northampton knife attack
text: a man in his 20s was temporarily blinded after being threatened with a knife and covered in a white powder in northampton last friday at about 22:15 .
it happened when he was walking along the path of billing brook , thorplands .
he was approached by a group of six young men who accosted hime , searched him and then ran away empty-handed .
police said it was unclear what the powder was , but the victim did not require hospital treatment and made recovered his sight .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rev richard coles : mum 's 'realistic ' response to strictly moves
text: although we might be in a bit of a spin that finedon 's famous vicar , reverend richard coles , will be foxtrotting his way onto strictly this season , his mum has taken a more realistic approach to the news !
the christian festival of michaelmas is on 29 september .
but the news has gone down well with finedon resident , mark wallace , who told me `` supercolesydoingstrictleyhisfoxtrotisprecocious '' .
me : `` i 'm doing # strictly '' .
mum : ( pause ) `` oh well you 'll be done by michaelmas '' .
i trust the bishop has approved this frivolity ?
both have .
is n't it in the 39 articles that vicars are n't allowed to dance on the evening before the sabbath ?
all the best !
we 'll be voting for you .
thanks tom !
and my husband says he hopes the dance moves have improved since the 80s and the never can say goodbye video .
not a whole lot .
oh that 's fantastic !
what joy xx
ta tracy !
that 's the best news for a while .
congrats , maestro , and happy feet
thank you .
tips ?
i can not tell you how much i am looking forward to this .
i will start sewing the sequins now for my viewing outfit .
show me this garb
starts stitching frantically while looking round for small nameless dwarf to do it for me .
first born child offered .
i 'm watching .
i 've never watched before .
have cha cha trophies from uni .
you know where to come .
on my way .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rev richard coles : 'in it to win it '
text: the former communards keyboard player said : `` cometh the hour , cometh the overweight vicar with arthritis in his knees '' after it was announced on bbc radio 2 's chris evans breakfast show that he will be joining the hit show , strictly come dancing .
`` a major dance talent was waiting to be discovered .
i just wonder what took them so long .
i 'm in it to win it , as they say , '' he added .
the finedon vicar must be feeling `` mighty real '' about lifting that glitter ball trophy then !
richard is a co-presenter of saturday live on bbc radio 4 - so i dare say he 'll be talking about his selection tomorrow morning :

documents.title: praise be - rev richard coles joins strictly come dancing
text: it 's that time of year again when we start to think about getting our glitter out and brushing up on our cha cha chas .

yes , the contestants for this year 's strictly come dancing are starting to be announced and we 've just found out that northamptonshire-based priest richard coles is set to be waltzing around his parish of finedon and samba-ing up the aisle at st mary 's church .
the cleric , broadcaster and former communards keyboard player , is the fifth celebrity to be announced and the first man of the cloth in strictly history .
he is also the only vicar in britain to have had a number one hit single with the communards - 1986 's biggest-selling uk single with their cover of do n't leave me this way .
what 's the betting the programme 's conductor dave arch has already worked out an arrangement for that ?
richard joins mollie king , davood ghadami , ruth langsford and yesterday 's announcement , gemma atkinson in the 2017 line-up .
holy glitterballs !
the @ twitterid is joining # strictly !
another fool whos just gon na be shit but will go far cus the stupid public will keep him in ! !
we may be surprised ! ! !
i reckon he has snake hips
well you do never know i guess .
i will publicly apologise to those who tweeted me their disgust oh sorry i cant they blocked me
that 's hilarious , people get angry about silly things .
he 's tough enough to cope with it .
i know always some1 who isnt so good who takes the place of some1 good i prob shouldve choosen my words better never mind
that has utterly made my day # sublime
life has just got a bit more random .
pray for us .
ca n't wait to watch , ca n't believe so many people on here do n't know rev richard - where have they been ? ! !
you 're my favourite

sorry , who is this gentleman ?

author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail user group 'concerned ' over change of operator
text: a group representing train passengers in northampton and long buckby has said it 's `` concerned '' about the change of operator announced by the government .

west midlands trains ltd - a joint venture between the dutch firm abellio and japanese partners - will take over the routes currently operated in northamptonshire , buckinghamshire , hertfordshire and the capital by london midland from december .
the new operator is promising extra capacity with new , longer , trains , but paul minton from the northampton rail users group says he fears it 's more about saving money .

he said : `` we 're particularly concerned that abellio may well put in a cost-cutting paper bid versus london midland which may have some service ramifications later - recognising that the department for transport were probably going to go for what was the lowest cost to run the franchise .
`` we 've not spotted anything which will give us a lot of faith otherwise at this stage . ''

documents.title: west midlands trains promise 'improvements from day one '
text: the new operators of commuter trains from milton keynes and northampton into london are promising improvements .
west midlands trains ltd will takeover the service from london midland in december .
the franchise also includes the bedford to bletchley , and st albans abbey to watford lines .
dominic booth , from west midlands trains , said : `` from day one we 'll start to work on daily punctuality and reliability improvements [ and ] compensation when we do get things wrong .

`` we 're changing that mechanism so that passengers are recompensed automatically for anything longer than a 15-minute delay , so passengers will start to see benefits and our investments coming in very early in the franchise . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

text: not every dog is feeling it at the international agility festival at rockingham castle today .
some just think it 's too much trouble and prefer a good old scratch instead !
agility ?
nah , it 's # nationallazyday # iaf2017
i can sympathise with this here
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hospital maternity unit downgrade agreed
text: hospital maternity unit downgrade agreed

documents.title: breakinghorton general hospital 's maternity unit downgraded
text: the board of the oxfordshire clinical commissioning group has voted in favour of permanently downgrading the horton 's maternity unit .

documents.title: delay on horton hospital future 'would lead to uncertainty '
text: the board continues to discuss the proposal to permanently downgrade the maternity unit at horton general hospital .
it was temporarily changed to a midwife-led unit last year due to a shortage of doctors .
louise wallace , lay member for public and patient involvement , said there were `` very , very , strong '' public views , adding that all of the 1,200 public comments were against the change .
she called for the decision to be delayed , but dr karen collision said that would lead to `` uncertainty '' .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: closure of 146 beds agreed across nhs trust
text: the latest from today 's meeting of oxfordshire 's clinical commissioning group ( occg ) is an agreement for the permanent closure of 146 hospital beds across oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust , to pay for more care outside of hospital .
of that number , 110 have already been closed as part of a trial which started in november 2016 .
the other 36 will be shut if occg can show progress in tackling delayed transfers of care - those patients who are in hospital but well enough to leave .
two more recommendations remain , including the controversial proposals for maternity services at horton general hospital .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: london midland loses west midlands rail franchise
text: the ownership of commuter trains into london is changing .
the government has awarded the franchise currently run by london midland to a new joint company , called west midlands rail , involving abellio and a japanese firm .

it will affect services from northampton , via milton keynes , leighton buzzard , hemel hempstead and watford into euston , as well as the bedford to bletchley service and the st albans abbey to watford line .
the changes will start in december , with extra trains being promised .
london midland managing director , patrick verwer , has congratulated the new firm and says it will `` bring much welcomed investment in new services and extra capacity across the network '' .
author: Lisa Wright
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: dog goes his own way at rockingham
text: it seems like you do n't always have to follow the lead at the international agility festival for dogs , which has started at rockingham castle today .
little papillon decided to do his own thing .
i do n't need your course , i can make my own !
little papillon goes rogue at the # iaf watch live on youtube now :
this is adorable !
little dog had a good time , people had a good laugh .
hope the owner was not too upset .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: stroke patients will no longer be taken to horton hospital
text: all patients in oxfordshire suspected of having suffered a stroke will be taken to the specialist unit at the john radcliffe hospital , health bosses have agreed .
it was the second of five recommendations being considered by oxfordshire clinical commissioning group 's board today .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: dogs on course to show off their skills at rockingham
text: dogs from around the world have started descending on rockingham castle for the kennel club 's international agility festival .
about 3,000 dogs will be tackling the obstacle courses from today until sunday .
judges will be looking for the healthiest , happiest dogs in a number of classes .
we 're underway on day 1 of the international agility festival at rockingham !
watch live on youtube now :
hi .
i 'd love to bring my grand-daughter to this on saturday .
what time does it start ?
many thanks
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mp says nhs proposals 'should be put on hold '
text: banbury mp victoria prentis has told the oxfordshire clinical commissioning group ( occg ) meeting that women will face one-and-half hour car journeys whilst in labour if new plans are approved .
she asked the board to put all the proposals on hold , except the recommendation to take all patients suspected of having suffered a stroke to the john radcliffe hospital in oxford .
meanwhile , witney & west oxfordshire mp robert courts said the constitution process was flawed and called for it to be restarted .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: keep the horton campaigners say consultation is 'flawed '
text: keith strangwood from keep the horton group argued the decision was all about money .
he said the occg needed to tell nhs england and the government that more money was needed .
`` government bailed out the banks , why ca n't it bail out the nhs ? , '' he asked .
he described the consultation and business plan as `` flawed '' .
`` today 's decision can not be made with such a weak business plan , '' he said .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: nhs meeting 'end of a long road of consultations '
text: this is the biggest shake-up the nhs in oxfordshire has seen for decades , and it 's proving controversial .
campaigners are worried the health plans amount to a `` downgrade '' of the horton hospital in banbury .

meanwhile health bosses insist its plans will mean a `` safe and sustainable '' service for patients , but they do admit they need to save £ 200m from health and social care services in oxfordshire by 2021 .
one of the most contentious points of this plan is what will happen to the maternity unit at banbury 's horton hospital .
it 's been temporarily downgraded to midwife-led because of a shortage of doctors .
today it will be decided if that change should be made permanent , although a committee of councillors earlier this week said it would refer that decision straight to the government .

but there are plenty of other big changes in this plan too , including the permanent closure of 146 beds , moving more stroke and critical care patients from the horton hospital to the john radcliffe , and providing more outpatient appointments at the horton .
even though today is the end of a long road of consultations and meetings , if the plan is passed , opposition to it is unlikely to go away .
author: Bethan Phillips
Political reporter, BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: hospital maternity unit could be permanently 'midwife-led '
text: a decision is expected today on whether to permanently downgrade a maternity unit at the horton general hospital in banbury .
in october , the facility became a `` midwife-led '' unit due to problems recruiting doctors .

nhs bosses want to make the change permanent and say midwife-led units offer an `` excellent option '' for women with low-risk pregnancies , but there was `` almost universal '' opposition in a public consultation - and concerns that many pregnant women in the south of the county could end up having a long journey to the john radcliffe hospital in oxford while in labour .

if the oxfordshire nhs clinical commissioning group presses ahead with the plans , the matter will be referred to the secretary of state , who could start a process to get the plan independently reviewed .
as well as oxfordshire the hospital serves brackley and south northamptonshire .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

we hope the wet weather does n't get you too down , but the good news is the weather is set to improve tomorrow , with some wait for it warmer spells expected .
right better get my factor 30 out !

BBC Local Live

documents.title: cycling sensation kiera byland competes in special olym
text: she 's already a special olym superstar , but 18-year-old kiera byland is on the hunt for more gold medals .
last night she co-hosted the opening ceremony in sheffield for over 2,600 athletes from across the country .
today she 's competing in the 10k time trial .
it was n't easy for kiera growing up with learning difficulties , but when she discovered cycling , her life changed dramatically .

documents.title: robinson 'rains ' supreme
text: the rain is getting a lot of people down , but not the twitter team at channel 4 .
we could n't resist sharing this post showing northampton 's very own ellie robinson when she came out to compete in the 2016 rio games .
walking outside into the rain like @ twitterid

documents.title: dementia care home plans approved
text: dementia care home plans approved

documents.title: dog that attacked four people could be put down
text: a dog that bit four people after escaping from a garden in northampton during storm doris could be put down .
northamptonshire police have applied for a civil destruction order on muppet , who was seized from ingleborough way , duston , on 23 february .
the dog 's owner has refused to sign a destruction order , so a hearing will take place at wellingborough magistrates ' court on 15 october .
in total , four people were bitten and needed medical treatment , whilst a man with a baby in a buggy and a child walking from school , were protected by police officers .
sgt liam o'neil said : `` letting the dog back was not an option .
there were too many victims for this to be considered a safe option . ''
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: extra anglian water teams out to deal with rain
text: anglian water have warned that because of the yellow weather warnings issued by the met office for rain for widespread parts of the region `` they have extra teams out on the ground to check the network is working as it should '' .
we are currently helping deal with flooding events around our region as a result of recent heavy rain .
these jobs will be prioritised .
@ twitterid we 're always ready to assist .
# floodalert

documents.title: northants v gloucs abandoned as a draw
text: northants v gloucs abandoned as a draw

documents.title: lead thieves target church three times
text: thieves have made three attempts to steal lead from a church in northamptonshire in the past 12 months .
on two occasions they were frightened away by an alarm but in may they managed to steal lead worth £ 14,000 from st mary the virgin in grafton regis .

church warden , jean glanville , said : `` it 's quite depressing that people do n't have any moral senses - that they feel it 's quite ok to come into somebody 's village and take what they want . ''
sgt sam dobbs from northamptonshire police says `` at the moment it 's not increasing , but it is national problem and a local problem '' .

documents.title: corby mp 'furious ' over urgent care centre uncertainty
text: yesterday we told you how the future of corby 's urgent care centre was still uncertain following a meeting which decided that it will stay open in the short term but there was a question mark over its long-term future .
today , corby 's mp has told bbc northampton that he 's `` furious '' at the continuing uncertainty .
tom pusglove said people need answers .
`` there are serious questions that must be answered and i 'm going to be probing the clinical commissioning group on this in the next couple of days , '' he said .

documents.title: yellow weather warning in place
text: as kate kinsella explained , the met office has released another a yellow weather warning for the east .
this means an area of heavy rain will sink slowly southwards across the east and southeast of england during today .
some transport routes may be affected by localised flooding leading to longer journey times .
in addition , flooding of homes and businesses is possible .
the heaviest of the rain should gradually become confined to the extreme southeast of the uk later in the day .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: weather : rain , heavy at times
text: it will be a cloudy day with outbreaks of rain , occasionally turning heavy and perhaps thundery in places .
under cloudy skies and with brisk winds , it will feel fairly cool for the time of year .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

documents.title: witness appeal after hobbycraft theft
text: thieves have stolen cash from a hobbycraft store in northampton after breaking in at the weekend .
northamptonshire police said the offenders forced their way in through the front entrance of the shop in tyne road at some point during the night over 4 and 5 august .
the men were seen on cctv and were wearing all black clothing , possibly biker clothing , and motorcycle helmets .
one of helmets had a black , white and possibly yellow detailing , while the other was black or navy with two white stripes .
the force has asked for anyone with any information to come forward .

it 's damp and dreary - and that 's putting it mildly , but we 'll try to brighten your day until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for your area .

documents.title: weather : more rain tonight and on wednesday
text: heavy , thundery showers will clear north eastwards across the bbc east region .
after some drier weather , a more prolonged period of rain will develop later and the temperature will drop to 12c ( 54f ) overnight .
wednesday will see more cloud with outbreaks of rain , some heavy at times .

for a more detailed forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: corby urgent care centre : ccg will try to strike a deal
text: nhs officials have agreed to continue to try and strike a deal to keep the corby urgent care centre open in the short term - with the current provider lakeside plus .
at a meeting this morning the nhs corby clinical commissioning group ( chc ) said in the longer term there would have to be changes .
lakeside plus has said it would pull out once its current contract ends on 30 september , claiming it 's not being paid enough by the chc to run the service .
it also said a legal decision last week on how much it should pay lakeside plus would have a `` significant '' impact .

that agreement meant the chc will have to pay an undisclosed larger amount and it will have to be backdated - a decision which has meant the chc is having to have discussions with nhs england about how it will fund this .
members of the public were allowed into today 's meeting , with some residents voicing their concerns about the situation .

documents.title: hanging 'bra-skets ' pop up across town
text: hanging 'bra-skets ' pop up across town

text: day three washed out at northampton

documents.title: knife with 20-inch blade on sale in northampton
text: northamptonshire police say they 're confident the legislation is in place to allow them to tackle knife crime .
radio northampton recently bought a crocodile dundee-style machete with a 20-inch blade from a gift shop in northampton town centre .
although shocking , such items are often not illegal as they can be used for legitimate purposes like gardening .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: awards for northampton 's best council house gardens
text: the first council house garden awards takes place in northampton today .
there are 28 gardens in the competition , which is run by northampton partnership homes .
there are six categories up for grabs , including best young gardener , most environmentally friendly garden and best communal garden .
northampton partnership homes hopes the competition will challenge stereotypes about people who live in council housing .
the awards ceremony takes place at bouverie house in hardingstone at 14:00 ,

documents.title: motorcylist dies after collision near daventry
text: a motorcyclist has died following a collision near daventry last night .
the motorcyclist was travelling on the a425 towards staverton from upper shuckburgh at about 17:35 , when it collided with a car travelling in the opposite direction .
the rider was taken to hospital with serious injuries , but died a soon after .
the car driver and three passengers , who were children , had minor injuries .
police are appealing for any information on the collision .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: future of urgent care centre to be discussed
text: the future of corby 's urgent care centre will be considered later this morning , with closure one of the options being discussed .
the contract to run the centre ends next month , but no bidders have come forward to operate it .
nhs corby clinical commissioning group is due to decide whether to close the facility or keep trying to find someone to run it .

documents.title: weather : widespread rain
text: it 's a wet start across much of the bbc east region , this morning .
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for rain , with thundery downpours possible .
a top temperature of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome back to local live across northamptonshire .
we 'll be here until 18:00 bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel for your area .
the full weather forecast will be with you shortly , but it 's a rather dark and dull start to the day .
as always if you want to get in touch you can by email , twitter and facebook .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gleeson takes five but northants stutter
text: gleeson takes five but northants stutter

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live updates for monday have come to an end , but we 'll be back with more news , sport , weather and travel updates at 08:00 on tuesday .
enjoy your evening .

documents.title: weather : a rainy week ahead
text: scattered showers this evening and overnight across the bbc east region , some on the heavy side .
eventually these showers will become confined to the north west of the region and many places becoming dry with some clear spells .
lows of around 12c ( 54f ) and light winds .
tuesday will see some further showers and some of these could be heavy , slow moving and perhaps thundery .
some areas could miss the showers entirely , but other parts could see two to three hours of heavy rain .
there is a yellow warning in place for this rain , with the risk of localised flooding .
the occasionally wet weather is due to last until friday .
for a detailed forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .

documents.title: 'glad they got there alright ' - man city goad cobblers over 'new ' kit
text: on friday , we told you how northampton town had revealed their new third kit for the 2017-18 season .
in case you missed it , here 's another look at the bold violet and orange strip
the shirt received a mixed response , with one supporter calling it `` horrendous '' , while another said they preferred it to the club 's new away kit .
but fans also noticed that the nike manufactured strip bore a striking resemblance to that which was worn by manchester city last season
and now the former premier league champions appear to have caught wind , with the citizens directing this gentle jibe at the league one club
but who wore it better ?
introducing our new third kit for the 2017/18 season .
on sale in store from 10am and online
can anyone give me a scenario when we will actually need to wear this ?
i do n't see black clash personally
yeah i suppose that 's the idea behind it , can imagine it being used on tuesday night away matches as well , e.g .
plymouth
will any of the shirts be available in toddler sizes ?
home shirts from 0 to 6 months
3-4 years ?
using man city 's third/european shirt from last season
nht 's shiny new third kit is totally different from man city 's old third .
the nike swoosh is black on this one .
already the 2018-19 home kit is leaked :
cobblers ! ! ! ! !
actually no it 's true class shirt
@ twitterid are just lazy , its nt a big team yes but a dfrnt design frm man city 16/17 3rd shirt would 've bn better .

northampton twitter is not up for the banter

documents.title: northants spinners enjoy conditionsnorthamptonshire 343 v gloucestershire 170-5
text: an intriguing period here with two spinners operating in tandem .
the on-loan left-arm spinner simon kerrigan has probed away well and the off-spin of rob keogh has produced a double breakthrough in the second hour after lunch to put northamptonshire on top .
this is a dry wicket and some help is there for the spinners .
criminally , gloucestershire lost both set batsmen and after two half-century stands , they need another partnership to get back into the game .
it 's not the the longest batting line-up they possess this week .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton Sport

documents.title: boy , 4 , hit by car in rushden
text: a four-year-old boy was injured after an accident in rushden on saturday afternoon .
the collision , in crown way near waitrose , involved a blue ford fiesta at about 16:00 , and happened as the boy was crossing the road with his family .
he was taken by air ambulance to queen 's medical centre in nottingham and has since been discharged .
police are asking an witnesses or anyone with information to call 101 .

documents.title: driver dies after lorry tips over in wellingborough
text: police say the driver of a lorry has died after a road accident in wellingborough last night .
it happened at about 22:00 when , for reasons not yet known , the white lgv tipped on to its side on niort way .
the driver died shortly afterwards , but no further details have been given at this time .
any witnesses are asked to contact the police .

documents.title: rain affecting northants chargenorthamptonshire 343 v gloucestershire 19-2
text: cloudier morning at wantage road - we 've already had a brief rain delay - and a better day to bowl than yesterday .
it 's a great chance for northamptonshire to get on top in the game after putting up 343 , a solid score but one which everyone here felt may be a little light .
will tavare has been struck a nasty blow on the elbow - a sign that this wicket is not playing true and is expected to become trickier as the game goes on .
both sides are playing specialist spinners as a result .
northants may need an outstanding session to have a chance of winning this game with the forecast so poor for the next two days of this game .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: rain stops plays
text: heavy shower at wantage rd and the players are off with @ twitterid 16/1 in the fifth over of the day # bbccricket

documents.title: county championship : northants look for wickets against glos
text: northamptonshire 's cricketers are fielding on day two of their county championship division two match against gloucestershire at wantage road .
yesterday , northants were bowled out for 343 , despite having been 153-1 at lunch .
live commentary from the bbc northampton sports team is available here .
its gloomy here at the county ground but play is due to start at 11am .
# norvglo
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: child crime figures fall in northamptonshire
text: the number of children being arrested by northamptonshire police has fallen by 66 % in the past six years , according to data from the howard league for penal reform .
the charity say police in the county made 885 arrests of children aged 17 and under last year , down from more than 2,500 in 2010 .

the howard league says keeping children out of the criminal justice system helps prevent crime , as the more contact a child has with it , the more entrenched they 're likely to become , which increases reoffending rates .
the charity has been working with police forces across the country to keep as many boys and girls as possible out of the system .
nationally , the total number of arrests has fallen too - down 64 % from almost 250,000 in 2010 to 87,525 in 2016 .

documents.title: weather : a drizzly morning
text: it 's quite a cloudy start across the bbc east region this morning with some outbreaks of rain .
the rain will clear slowly through the day , allowing some brighter skies to follow .
a top temperature of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather
